events.name: Intralinks Singapore: Artificial Intelligence for Corporate Law Departments
events.description:
SAVE UP TO 60% MORE TIME ON CONTRACT REVIEWWITH ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE (AI) FOR CORPORATE LAW DEPARTMENTS
As information grows and transactions become more complex, legal professionals are leveraging the power of technology to keep up with the challenge.
A better understanding of the ways AI speeds up review is the first step to making your job a lot easier.
As a global leader in technology solutions for strategic transactions, we are excited to introduce our partnership with Kira Systems. Kira is powerful, award-winning machine learning software that expedites contract review and minimizes transaction costs. It has been trusted on over US$100 billion of M&A transactions, and is in enterprise use at some of the world’s largest professional services firms.
Complimentary Attendance and LunchWe are pleased to invite you to an exclusive lunch seminar on the latest advances in legal technology for corporate transactions. Join your colleagues in learning how to stay ahead of the technology curve by expediting transaction execution, minimizing risk and reducing transactional costs.
Why Attend Event?
• Learn about the best practices of global corporate law groups and discover how they are using artificial intelligence to expedite contract review.
• Find out about secured content sharing between in-house and outside counsel that helps bridge communication gaps, and extends security and auditability beyond your firewall.
Seats are LimitedReserve yours by registering today!
events.location: Mandarin Orchard Singapore, Meeting Room 833, Level 8 Main Tower, Mandarin Orchard Singapore by Meritus, 333 Orchard Road, SINGAPORE 238867

events.name: IoTTechspresso- IoT in Residential Space
events.description: To get the most Jetsons-like experience from your smart home, devices need to speak the same language. If you want your smart bed to notice when you are awake, open your smart blinds, tune your smart audio system to Morning Edition, and tell your smart coffeemaker to start brewing, all of these devices need to communicate on the same radio frequency using the same protocols.  Qi da is an engineer in Panasonic, involved in the technical aspect of things, such as software coding, debugging and designing.  He maintain and operate the cloud-based energy management system for Panasonic's air-conditioners, ensuring that the servers are always online.   He is now mainly focusing on promoting new technologies from Japan around Asia region. ************************************************************ DATE & AGENDA: Thursday, 8th Sept 2016 • 06:00 pm – Registration & Networking  • 06:45 pm – Introduction  • 07:00 pm – Expert Talk by Qi Da  • 08:00 pm - QnA  • 08:30 pm - Networking continued ************************************************************  VENUE: NUS Enterprise@Blk71, 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent #02-01, SG139951 ************************************************************  ************************************************************  Note: Please note that photography and videography will be carried out throughout the event.  IoT SG, Event Sponsors, Supporters may use some or all of these images in its print publications, digital, social platforms and/or marketing channels. We also ask some personal information and questions during registration. This data is used to do further due diligence to improve the quality of events. This data may also be shared with sponsoring organisations, speakers to help them to collaborate more efficiently. We do not sell your data.
events.location: NUS Enterprise@Blk71, 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent, #02-01, Singapore 139951
